concept.title: Events in
concept.shortdesc: Events are interactions between a customer and your organization or brand. The customer paths in your Journey Analytics reports can include any events that are shared with Journey Analytics by event publishers through IBM Universal Behavior Exchange (UBX).

conbody.p: Event types vary according to channel. For example, in the Web channel, event data is captured when a customer performs a cart purchase, completes a conversion, or views information about a product. In the Email channel, event data is captured when a user opens an email or clicks a link in an email.

For each channel in a path, you can gain a deeper understanding of how customers interacted in the channel by comparing the different events that occurred in the channel. Looking at the events that are associated with each channel in a customer path can help you answer the following types of questions:

ul.li: What are the most common customer behaviors within a channel? When customers visit your website, what do they do most often?
What are the most common events across all channels in the path? For example, if customers experience a struggle in the web channel, do they also experience struggles in other channels?
For an event that can occur in more than one channel, is it more common in one channel than in another? For example, do more customers watch a video on your website than on your mobile application?

section.title: Event attributes
section.p: Each event consists of attributes that are specific to the event type. For example, the Viewed Product event contains attributes for the category, name, and description of the event, the URL of the product image, and product size. When you define the journey paths that you want to analyze, you can use one or more event attributes to confine your results to a particular subset of customers. For example, you can filter the Product Name attribute of the Cart Purchased event to limit your results to customers who purchased a particular product.

For descriptions of all the events available in and their attributes, see the Events reference. For more information about event subscription and event publishing, see the IBM Universal Behavior Exchange documentation.
